alert.note: Alert for Emery (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 26 at 12:20PM MDT until August 26 at 3:15PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: The National Weather Service in Salt Lake City has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The Trail Mountain Burn Scar in... West Central Emery County in central Utah... * Until 315 PM MDT. * At 1220 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Trail Mountain Burn Scar. Up to 0.5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will result in debris flow moving through Huntington Canyon. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Trail Mountain Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Trail Mountain Burn Scar. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Huntington. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: A debris flow is expected to impact Huntington Creek, spring water supply infrastructure, and potentially the Crandall Canyon Monument. Additionally the water intakes for the Huntington Power Plant just upstream from Huntington, and the Huntington Cleveland Irrigation Company may be impacted.
